info.author: Georgi Dimitrov
info.description:
=====
trask
=====
Trask is a tool that allows you to track your tasks. The interface is very simple to save you from dealing with weird commands.
To start using it, all you neeed is to type::

    $ trask start "My new favourite task"

To list all the task you've worked on::

    $ trask status
    ID           NAME                      CREATED_AT            STARTED_AT            STOPPED_AT    DURATION   IS_STARTED
    fc6f10a819   "My new favourite task"   2015-05-21T19:30:14   2015-05-21T19:30:14   NEVER         00:00:04          YES

When you're done working on that task or you want to pause it, just do::

    $ trask stop fc6f10a819

You can also use names to start/ stop tasks::

    $ trask start "My new not so favourite task"

    $ trask status
    ID           NAME                             CREATED_AT            STARTED_AT            STOPPED_AT             DURATION   IS_STARTED
    fc6f10a819   "My new favourite task"          2015-05-21T19:30:14   2015-05-21T19:30:14   2015-05-21T19:31:23    00:01:09           NO
    5581e877b4   "My new not so favourite task"   2015-05-21T19:31:23   2015-05-21T19:31:23   NEVER                  00:00:07          YES

    $ trask stop "My new not so favourite task"

All the tasks are stored in a `.trasks.json` file in your home directory.

Installation instructions
=========================
Trask is available on PyPI: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/trask

    $ pip install trask

Usage
=====
::

  Usage: trask [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
  
    Simple command line tool to track your tasks.
  
  Options:
    -f, --file PATH  File to be used for storing tasks. Default is
                     ~/.trasks.json
    -h, --help       Show this message and exit.
  
  Commands:
    start   Start a new task or resume a stopped one.
    status  List all tasks.
    stop    Stop a running task.

Use bash autocomplete 
======================================================
This feature is only available for commands and options::

    $ _TRASK_COMPLETE=source trask > ~/.trask-complete.sh
    $ source ~/.trask-complete.sh
info.name: trask
info.summary: A simple command line tool to track your tasks.
